qas.question: In what year did Arsenal first create a crest for the team?
What part of the Arsenal crest is sometimes mistaken for chimneys?
After the team moved to what city were the cannon left off the crest?
What nickname prompted a return to the canon on the club crest?
In what year was the canon image further refined on the Arsenal crest?
In what year did the Metropolitan Borough of Woolwich develop its coat of arms?
In what year did the Metropolitan Borough of Woolwich transfer to the coat of arms of the Royal Borough of Greenwhich?

plausible_answers.text: three cannon viewed from above, pointing northwards

qas.question: What was the Arsenal crest from 1913 to 1921?
What has been the Arsenal crest since 1925?
Where did Arsenal play prior to 1913?

context: Unveiled in <a0_0><b5_0>1888<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Royal Arsenal's first crest featured <a1_0><b7_0>three cannon<a1_0/> viewed from above, pointing northwards<b7_0/>, similar to the coat of arms of the Metropolitan Borough of Woolwich (nowadays transferred to the coat of arms of the Royal Borough of Greenwich). These can sometimes be mistaken for chimneys, but the presence of a carved lion's head and a cascabel on each are clear indicators that they are cannon. This was dropped after the move to <a2_0><b9_0>Highbury<b9_0/><a2_0/> in 1913, only to be reinstated in <b6_0>1922<b6_0/>, when the club adopted a crest featuring a <b8_0>single cannon, pointing eastwards<b8_0/>, with the club's nickname, <a3_0>The Gunners<a3_0/>, inscribed alongside it; this crest only lasted until <a4_0>1925<a4_0/>, when the cannon was reversed to point westward and its barrel slimmed down.
